column4: I have a SATA DVD drive that Ubuntu can read data from but can't play movies from. I've installed all of the necessary codecs, but still can't play video. I've tried VLC, Mplayer, Totem, and Movie Player. What am I missing?
what is your DVD drives device name ?
scd0
try setting that in vlc settings. usually all the DVD player jump through some symlink /dev/dvd , which might be simply wrong in your case
I've checked the VLC settings -- that's actually where I originally got the device name
check dmesg if that's really the device name... could be sr0 or something more exotic
How do I go about using dmesg?
just open a terminal and run 'dmesg | most'
just open a terminal and run 'dmesg |  less' , rather
yeah, I'm looking at it now
so skim over it and try to figure out what the kernel thinks about your drive
Any idea whether there's something specific I should look for? "DVD", for instance?
that differs from machine to machine.. you could !pastebin it if you want me to have a look
!paste | Sitting_Duck
Yeah, I've used it. I'll do that.
Actually, I just noticed that the last huge chunk of the file is nothing but lines like: [444555.243746] end_request: I/O error, dev sr0, sector 4251180
oh, that's something ... you have libdvdcss, haven't you ?
I do
I do, yeah
At least, I've installed libdvdcss2 a couple of times. Also, the ubuntu restricted drivers.
could it ba that just the DVD medium is bad ?
I doubt it -- it's a borrowed DVD that my friend just bought. He watched it yesterday, if I'm not mistaken.
